data.title: Buddy Rogers correspondence
data.text:
Mary Pickford, America's Sweetheart, was a star of both stage and film. Born in Toronto, Canada in 1893 she is best known as a star of silent films. Her first film was with Biograph studio where she was taken on by D. W. Griffith. Among her films are The Little American (1917), Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm (1917), Little Lord Fauntleroy(1921), and Rosita (1923). Her career in sound films was short-lived and included an Oscar winning performance in Coquette(1929), and The Taming of the Shrew (1929). She was married to Owen Moore, Douglas Fairbanks and Charles "Buddy" Rogers. She died in 1979.

Charles "Buddy" Rogers was born in Olanthe, Kansas in 1904. A leading man in early Hollywood films, Rogers appeared opposite Mary Pickford in My Best Girl (1927). Other films include Wings (1927), Abie's Irish Rose (1928), and The Road to Reno(1931) to name a few. He married Mary Pickford in 1935 and was her husband until her death in 1979.

The Mary Pickford and Buddy Rogers Correspondence consists of letters written by Ms. Pickford, Mr. Rogers and their secretaries to long time friend of Mary Pickford, Blanche Shield. The letters span the years 1943 - 1976 and include information on the personal and professional lives of Mary Pickford, Buddy Rogers and their two children. Most of these letters were prompted by gifts sent to Pickford and Rogers by Blanche Shield for Christmas, birthdays, anniversaries and Easter.

The Mary Pickford-Buddy Rogers correspondence is arranged in four series:

41 letters

The Mary Pickford Correspondence Series consists of letters typed or handwritten and signed personally by Mary Pickford to Blanche Shield. Many of the letters contain information on her personal life and activities.

30 letters

The Secretary Correspondence Series consists of letters written by Mary Pickford's secretaries to Blanche Shield. Included in these letters are those written by Jean Patriquin, Diane Van Valen and Esther Helm. The letters appear to be written by the secretaries when Mary Pickford was out-of-town. A friendly correspondence grew between Blanche Shield and Diane Van Valen and some of these letters contain information primarily about Ms. Van Valen's personal and professional life.

30 letters

The Buddy Rogers Correspondence Series consists of notes and letters written by Buddy Rogers. They contain almost no personal information and consist mainly of quick holiday greetings and thank you's for gifts.

3 items

This series contains color and black and white photographs of Mary Pickford and Buddy Rogers in their home, Pickfair. They are Christmas greeting cards.
